page.title: 04WINTER AND SUMMER, BELTHORNE
page.content:
This is an isolated part of Lancashire, the main centres of population being some miles away. The people who live in this area have to be able to look after themselves and a car would seem to be essential. It is very pleasant in the Spring and Summer, especially if you like bleak, open moorland, but it often rains a great deal of the time.
In the Winter the roads are often blocked off with snow or are unsafe because of ice. The sheep are at risk because they might get stuck in the snow and freeze to death.
Farmers will have to look after the cows inside and keep them warm or they might die.
